snippet: RIM says in a filing to the S.E.C. that the access fees it charges may fall under pressure if the new products it plans to start selling this year do not use the network infrastructure in the same way or to the same extent as the company's current...
abstract: RIM says in a filing to the S.E.C. that the access fees it charges may fall under pressure if the new products it plans to start selling this year do not use the network infrastructure in the same way or to the same extent as the company's current products. Those fees account for the bulk of RIM's services revenue, which was 22 percent of its business last year.

headline.main: RIM Warns Lucrative Fees May Decline

snippet: Libraries are striving to make borrowing e-books easier, but restrictions from publishers are making the process harder.
abstract: Libraries are striving to make borrowing e-books easier, but restrictions from publishers are making the process harder.

headline.main: E-Book Borrowing, Preceded by E-Book Waiting
headline.print_headline: E-Book Borrowing, Preceded by E-Book Waiting

snippet: In a letter to Illumina's shareholders, Roche's chief executive, Severin Schwan, said there were few parallels between the iPhone maker and the genetic analysis provider, despite statements from the board that suggest otherwise.
abstract: In a letter to Illumina's shareholders, Roche's chief executive, Severin Schwan, said there were few parallels between the iPhone maker and the genetic analysis provider, despite statements from the board that suggest otherwise.

snippet: Apps like DataMan and 3G Watchdog will analyze a mobile device’s data use by app, and alert the user when a limit is reached.
abstract: Bob Tedeschi App Smart column on applications that track data usage on mobile devices.

headline.main: Help for Users Who Push Their Data Plans to the Limit
headline.print_headline: Help for Users Who Push Their Data Plans to the Limit

snippet: There are plenty of astronomy apps, but few can match the new release of Brian Cox's Wonders of the Universe, which goes much further than just naming stars to helping you understand them.
abstract: There are plenty of astronomy apps, but few can match the new release of Brian Cox's Wonders of the Universe, which goes much further than just naming stars to helping you understand them.

headline.main: App Smart Extra: Across the Universe

snippet: AT&T will allow people to unlock their iPhones, which would mean that the phone could be used on other GSM networks.
abstract: AT&T will allow people to unlock their iPhones, which would mean that the phone could be used on other GSM networks.

headline.main: How to Get AT&T to Unlock Your iPhone

snippet: The Next Issue app, available for some Android tablets, offers unlimited downloads of a host of popular magazines for one flat fee.
abstract: David Pogue State of the Art column; five big magazine publishers--Conde Nast, Hearst, Meredith, News Corporation and Time Inc--collaborate on Next Issue app, which offers downloads of popular magazines to certain Android tablets for one flat free.

headline.main: A Buffet of Magazines on a Tablet
headline.print_headline: A Buffet Of Magazines On a Tablet

snippet: The Justice Department filed an antitrust lawsuit charging that Apple and others colluded to raise the price of e-books in 2010. Several publishers have agreed to a settlement.
abstract: The Justice Department filed an antitrust lawsuit charging that Apple and others colluded to raise the price of e-books in 2010. Several publishers have agreed to a settlement.

headline.main: Justice Dept. Sues Apple and Publishers Over E-Book Pricing; 3 Publishers Settle
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sues Apple and Publishers Over E-Book Pricing

snippet: Facebook's acquisition of Instagram could be something of a turning point, as even Facebook tries to get a better grasp on a market that requires a rethinking of old rules. But it was probably not crazy to pay $1 billion.
abstract: Facebook's acquisition of Instagram could be something of a turning point, as even Facebook tries to get a better grasp on a market that requires a rethinking of old rules. But it was probably not crazy to pay $1 billion.

headline.main: Daily Report: A Turning Point for Mobile

snippet: At Trademarkia, “We want to make applying for a trademark as easy as getting a domain name,” said Raj Abhyanker, one of the company’s founders.
abstract: At Trademarkia, “We want to make applying for a trademark as easy as getting a domain name,” said Raj Abhyanker, one of the company’s founders.

headline.main: A Start-Up Rethinks the Process of Getting a Trademark
